Some of the best anime from Japan has been on Adult Swim.  i.e. Cowboy Bebop, Dragon Ball Z, Inu Yasha, and NGE to name a few.  (granted watching the DVDs with subtitles is much better =b )

If you watch FMA anime, then read the manga as well.  It's nice to see things happen in a different way.  Also, some details don't make it into the anime.

Death Note felt too "perfect" (as in everything happened just the way it needed to).  In the second half, this is especially the case.  The ending (at least in the manga) felt bland.

Kill la Kill and tengen topa gurren lagan are a must watch.

If you like some comedy in your life try Kore wa Zombie desu ka? 1&2. (possibliy as good as FMP was?)....

oh YEAH Full Metal Panic! Possibly the funniest show of the decade (2000-2010.) I've never laughed so much at an anime in general than i have at this show(even including excel saga :O).

But if u do watch it, just remember the 1st season watch first, then Fumofu(the gut busting funny stuff), then the 2nd season(second raid). That will keep you in chronological order i believe. However, beware the 2nd season seems to have much darker themes then the 1st season xD.

if you like Toradora, you may want to check out Lovely Complex (romance comedy), Say I Love You, and Kimi Ni Todoke. These are all romance intensive anime that i enjoyed. (Lovely Complex was on youtube last i looked, and the other two are on Hulu)

Other anime that i've enjoyed recently are Tokyo Ghoul (a modern classic IMO; superb), The Devil is a Part Timer (hysterical fantasy trope reversal), and Madoka Magica (i'm only on episode 3 so far, but i am very impressed by it). Tokyo Ghoul is on Hulu, the other two are on Netflix.
